tagline: moqingbiRT is a mocking framework for Windows 8 Metro style applications, a.k.a. WinRT, based on moq's syntax.
name: Moqingbirt
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
body:
### Goal Its goal is to make up for the lack of support of moq on this plateform. Since moq's internals are not available on WinRT, moqingbiRT works around this limitation by using an other mechanism to implement the behavior of the mocked objects. Its initial integration within a project is slightly different than moq's, but once integrated in the project to be tested, moqingbiRT's syntax is next-to-identical to moq's. ### Current status moqingbiRT's is in very early stages at the moment, and might not keep its promises, so even if the sources are publicly available right now, the Framework cannot be leveraged just yet. Stay tuned, as things are likely to move pretty fast. ### Where to find us moqingbiRT's source code is available on GitHub. moqingbiRT is continuously integrated by jetbrains' Team City, thanks to [Jetbrains](http://www.jetbrains.com) and [codebetter.com](http://www.codebetter.com) ![continuous integration server](http://www.jetbrains.com/img/banners/Codebetter.png)
keyboard-centric bug tracker continuous integration server
